page.title: 05Gorran - Population
page.content: Apart from the village of Gorran Haven the area is sparsely populated,with only the old farmhouses at Carvinnick, Treveague,Penare and the imposing Lamledra House (built in 1910 as a holiday home and later used as a school).Gorran Haven itself is a mixture of old and new.The original houses are grouped around Church St. and Rattle St. leading down to the harbour - some date back to 1550.Sadly most of these old cottages are empty for most of the year,being used now as holiday homes.A row of coastguard cottages built in 1867 overlook the harbour - there is one coastguard resident now.Most of the houses in Gorran Haven have been built during the past 25 years - modern bungalows stretching up the hill,competing for a view of the sea.Fortunately the heart of the village remains unchanged.
